intro: Cerastium brachyodon, commonly known as the short-stemmed mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, commonly known as the carnation family. The plant features small, hairy stems and clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically rounded and covered in fine, soft hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Cerastium brachyodon thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks.
